Silence::

She smiled back at him, but spoke matter of factly, "I have lost some
of the data in my memory core. Too many factors to dictate which exact
one it could be. But of this I am certain, my recon and combat skills
are intact."  She lowered her head as a momentaty recognition of a
lost piece of data crossed her mental circuits. "Oh, perhaps retrieval
would not be an ill-advised solution. I may be able to have my records
restored."  An image flashed through her  mind faster than she could
comprihend it. But a tear fell from her cheek, though she did n[t feel
the emotion, it fell from a long distant reaction.  She looked at the
drop of water that fell to her hand. "Odd, perhaps I am in need of
repair.  I am leaking from my optics." Her tone of voice showed no
emotion, perfectly monotone. "So, I was sent to help the Maximals. BUt
so far, my mission orders are lost. Perhaps you will inform me of what
our current situation is?"


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Rodimus:
> 
> Rodimus smiled trying to made Silence feel confortable, and said "I
guess that you have... Forgotten someting. It may be temporal or
perhaps Kup, can help ya... "
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Dark Mouse 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Friday, March 25, 2005 6:25 PM
>   Subject: Re: Silence
> 
> 
> 
>   Silence::
> 
>   She tilted her head slghtly to one side and righted it again. She
>   semi-smiled at him.  She felt a little uncomfortable.  "I am Silence.
>   Maximal from, ah, well, data banks are incomplete. Programmed am I
>   with many reconicence programs and battle sequences.  Night vision and
>   long range vision with audio anhancement technology. I am deamed
>   sniper and watchbot."  Her head lowered as she heard her own programs
>   spin in her head.  So many spaces, so much data lost. Scrambled were
>   things she felt she needed to know. Too much time in a pod with too
>   little power to sustain all her functions. She knew she spoke the
>   truth. To do so would be very detrimental to all those who put trust
>   in her. She looked back up at him. "I am Silence. What orders do you
>   hace for this Captain of the Ranks?"  Captain? she thought to herself.
>   Where did I come up with that rank. But some how, that felt rather
>   correct. It must have been her rank before she arrived here. If only
>   she could remember time before waking up in the pod.
